item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 5, 2025 at 2:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A story on home server security (57 points | 45 comments)
2. How Nat Traversal Works (2020) (109 points | 21 comments)
3. Show HN: Struggle with CSS Flexbox? This Playground Is for You (112 points | 37 comments)
4. Supernovae evidence for foundational change to cosmological models (7 points | 2 comments)
5. The Evolution of Tunnel Boring Machines (24 points | 6 comments)
6. Researchers design wearable tech that can sense glucose levels more accurately (270 points | 98 comments)
7. Guten: A Tiny Newspaper Printer (175 points | 72 comments)
8. Nanoimprint Lithography Aims to Take on EUV (71 points | 36 comments)
9. Wildcard: Customize HN using a spreadsheet view (62 points | 6 comments)
10. Sailor Poets Take over U.S. Navy Deck Logs on New Year's Day (39 points | 5 comments)
11. Counterculture legend who invented bell-bottom jeans dies at 84 (15 points | 4 comments)
12. Combining 15s interval whole-sky-camera photos to form a 4y spanning keogram (456 points | 68 comments)
13. The largest hydroelectric dam in the world has been approved (16 points | 16 comments)
14. 2024: A Record-Breaking Year for the Ocean Cleanup (15 points | 5 comments)
15. Blur Busters Open Source Display Initiative – Refresh Cycle Shaders (61 points | 25 comments)
16. Social Media Distorts Perceptions of Norms (70 points | 54 comments)
17. The Maritime Approximation (12 points | 3 comments)
18. Refurb Weekend: Atari Stacy (50 points | 2 comments)
19. ELKS: Linux for 16-bit Intel Processors (174 points | 84 comments)
20. How to draw an outline in a video game (510 points | 56 comments)
21. Myst Markdown – Markdown for technical/scientific document (100 points | 18 comments)
22. The funniest thing I ever did – a.k.a. "How To Make $100K From A Dick Joke." (114 points | 20 comments)
23. Discuo – Anonymous discussions with infinite branching and 24h lifespan (22 points | 29 comments)
24. Hacker gains access to the RP2350 OTP secret by glitching the RISC-V cores (145 points | 19 comments)
25. The comb jelly can fuse with another (including nervous and digestive systems) (69 points | 13 comments)
26. One Dog vs. the Windows 3.1 Graphics Stack (209 points | 76 comments)
27. GPON FTTH networks (in)security (2016) (42 points | 11 comments)
28. Hornet, RNA structure visualization method correlates sequence and 3D topology (26 points | 6 comments)
29. Labwc: Wlroots-based window-stacking compositor for Wayland, inspired by openbox (58 points | 11 comments)
30. It Matters Who Owns Your Copylefted Copyrights (2021) (109 points | 156 comments)
